work.p: It is possible that this list contributed, indirectly, to the ideas found in what became the second section of the poem eventually titled "Song of Myself." Those lines deal with breath, scents, and sexuality, all of which are suggested in the terms in this manuscript.

a machine readable transcription

notesStmt.note: This list may have contributed indirectly to the ideas found in what became the second section of the poem eventually titled "Song of Myself." Those lines deal with breath, scents, and sexuality, all of which are suggested by the terms in this manuscript. Because the manuscript has not been located it is difficult to speculate on the circumstances or date of its composition, but it seems possible that it was written before or early in 1855.

biblStruct.note: Grier derives his text from Notes & Fragments, ed. Richard Maurice Bucke (London, Ontario: A. Talbot & Co., printers, 1899), 169.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Breathjuice
bibl.orgName: The location of this manuscript is unknown.
